description: Emergency assistance, food, clothing, financial aid, and educational programs serving North Fulton.

name: The Drake House
description: Addresses homelessness of single mothers and their children in North Fulton; offers transitional housing, mentoring, employment, and housing-stability support.

name: Women Are Dreamers Too
description: Offers emergency shelter and domestic violence support for women and families in the Alpharetta area.

name: North Fulton Homeless Assessment Center
description: Fulton County program serving North Fulton residents for homelessness assessment and housing placement.

name: HomeStretch
description: Nonprofit providing transitional housing and support for homeless families in North Fulton.

name: Family Promise of North Fulton/DeKalb
description: Helps homeless families achieve sustainable independence through housing and support programs.

name: The Place of Forsyth County
description: Serves Alpharetta-adjacent areas with housing, rent, and emergency aid programs.

name: MUST Ministries North Fulton
description: Provides shelter placement assistance, food, and employment resources for families and individuals.

name: Fulton County Continuum of Care (CoC)
description: Coordinates homeless services, transitional housing, and outreach in North Fulton and Alpharetta.

name: Georgia Department of Community Affairs (DCA)
description: Statewide agency offering homelessness prevention and housing assistance resources for Alpharetta residents.
